intro: Adenosma javanica, commonly known as the Java adenostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an erect herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and have five petals, often with a distinctive yellowish or white color. Adenosma javanica is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream sides.
